intro: Rapanea lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai holly, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as laurel and cinnamon. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which is typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by small, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
